sect1.title: #OPTION

row.entry: A case sensitive string constant containing the name of the option to set.
The value to set the option to. This may be any type of value, dependent on what the option expects to be.

sect1.para: The #OPTION statement is typically a compiler directive giving hints to the code generator as to how best to generate the executable code for a workunit. This statement may be used outside an XML scope and does not require a previous call to the LOADXML function to instantiate an XML scope.

sect2.title: Definition of Terms
sect2.para: These definitions are "internal-only" terms used in the option definitions that follow.

row.entry: To turn a complex expression into a simpler equivalent one. For example, the expression "1+1" can be replaced with "2" without altering the result.
Writing intermediate result sets to disk so that memory is available for subsequent steps.
The + (append file) operator between datasets can be visualized as pouring all the records into a funnel and getting a single stream of records out of the bottom; hence the term "funnel."

An internally generated activity used in place of CHOOSEN(SORT(xx), n) where n is small, as it can be computed much more efficiently than sorting the entire record set then discarding all but the first n.
An ECL operator that takes one or more datasets as inputs.
All the Activities in a query.
A collection of Activities that can all be active at the same time in Thor.
A method of code optimization that looks at a small amount of the unoptimized code at a time, in order to combine operations into more efficient ones.

para.emphasis: The following options are all about generating Logical graphs in a workunit.

sect2.para: Logical graphs Logical graphs are stored in the workunit and viewed in ECL Watch. They include information about which attribute/line number/column the symbols are defined in. Exported attributes are represented by <module>.<attribute> in the header of the activity. Non-exported (local) attributes are represented as <module>.<exported-attribute>::<non-exported-name>

sect2.para: These options should be left alone unless you REALLY know what you are doing. Typically they are used internally by our developers to enable/disable features that are still in development. Occasionally the technical support staff will suggest that you change one of these settings to work around a problem that you encounter, but otherwise the default settings are recommended in all cases.
